fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http

Interface ICookie


  • public interface ICookie
    HTTP header cookie representation.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDomain()
      Gets the cookie's domain.
      int getMaxAge()
      Gets the maximum age allowed for the cookie, in seconds.
      String getName()
      Gets the cookie's name.
      URI getPath()
      Gets the cookie's path.
      String getValue()
      Gets the cookie's value.
      boolean isHttpOnly()
      Indicates if this is an HTTP-only cookie.
      boolean isSecure()
      Indicates if the browser is required to send the cookie over a secure protocol (SSL, TLS).
      void setDomain(String cookieDomain)
      Sets the cookie's domain.
      void setHttpOnly(boolean httpOnly)
      Sets whether this is an HTTP-only cookie.
      void setMaxAge(int maxAgeInSeconds)
      Sets the maximum age allowed for the cookie, in seconds.
      void setPath(URI cookiePath)
      Sets the cookie's path.
      void setSecure(boolean requiresSecureProtocol)
      Sets whether the browser is required to send the cookie over a secure protocol (SSL, TLS) or if unsecure protocols may be used.
      void setValue(String value)
      Sets the cookie's value.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the cookie's name.
        Returns:
        the non-null, non-empty name of the cookie.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getValue

        String getValue()
        Gets the cookie's value.
        Returns:
        the non-null cookie value.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setValue

        void setValue(String value)
        Sets the cookie's value.
        Parameters:
        value - the non-null cookie value.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPath

        URI getPath()
        Gets the cookie's path.
        Returns:
        the path.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setPath

        void setPath(URI cookiePath)
        Sets the cookie's path.
        Parameters:
        cookiePath - the path. May be null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDomain

        String getDomain()
        Gets the cookie's domain.
        Returns:
        the domain.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setDomain

        void setDomain(String cookieDomain)
        Sets the cookie's domain.
        Parameters:
        cookieDomain - the domain. May be null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getMaxAge

        int getMaxAge()
        Gets the maximum age allowed for the cookie, in seconds.
        Returns:
        the maximum age, in seconds. If -1, then the cookie should not expire until the client browser stops running.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setMaxAge

        void setMaxAge(int maxAgeInSeconds)
        Sets the maximum age allowed for the cookie, in seconds. After the maximum age is reached, the cookie expires.
        Parameters:
        maxAgeInSeconds - the maximum age, in seconds. If -1, then the cookie should not expire until the client browser stops running.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isHttpOnly

        boolean isHttpOnly()
        Indicates if this is an HTTP-only cookie. Modern browsers prevent access to HTTP-only cookies from JavaScript code.

        By default, this is false (cookies are therefore visible by default to JavaScript code when the client is a modern browser). Note however that session cookies, when used, should be HTTP-only.

        Returns:
        true if this is marked as an HTTP-only cookie, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setHttpOnly

        void setHttpOnly(boolean httpOnly)
        Sets whether this is an HTTP-only cookie.
        Parameters:
        httpOnly - true to mark this as an HTTP-only cookie.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isSecure

        boolean isSecure()
        Indicates if the browser is required to send the cookie over a secure protocol (SSL, TLS).

        By default, this is false (a secure protocol is not required).

        Returns:
        true if a secure protocol is required for transmission, false if use with unencrypted HTTP is acceptable.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setSecure

        void setSecure(boolean requiresSecureProtocol)
        Sets whether the browser is required to send the cookie over a secure protocol (SSL, TLS) or if unsecure protocols may be used.
        Parameters:
        requiresSecureProtocol - true if a secure protocol is required for transmission, false if use with unencrypted HTTP is acceptable.
        Since:
        1.0
